titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Helen Herron Taft Manning (1891-1987) was the daughter of President of the United States William Howard Taft and his wife Helen Herron. Taft graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1915, was named dean in 1917 and rose to acting president in 1919. She left to earn her doctorate at Yale, reclaiming the deanship in 1925. In 1920, she married Frederick Johnson Manning, a history professor who taught at Swarthmore College.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Helen Taft Manning and Frederick J. Manning. Materials include: correspondence between the Mannings (1917-1966); Manning family papers and records related to the William Howard Taft papers held at the Library of Congress; correspondence, speeches, and other documents from Helen Manning's time at Bryn Mawr College, both as a Dean and as an alumna; correspondence between Helen Manning and friends and family; documents relating to Helen Manning's publications; clippings; and sketches by Frederick Manning.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Library of Congress: Papers of Helen Taft Manning and Papers of William H. Taft.
